answers.answer: charcot foot usually occurs from having diabetes or severe peripheral neuropathy.a custom made "Crow's Boot" can greatly provide support and allow you to put more weight on the foot.  (your doctor will have to refer you to a pedorthist to cast you for the boot) if the condition worsens, you can have your foot surgically corrected.  by using external fixation rings, you can reposition and fuse the joints so they are no longer collapsed.
